meanings.sent1: The old blanket looked even frowsier after being left out in the rain.
meanings.sent2: Her room became frowsier as she neglected to tidy up for weeks.
meanings.sent3: The frowsier cat in the shelter caught everyone's attention with its playful antics.
meanings.sent4: The frowsier garden seemed to whisper tales of neglect and forgotten beauty.
meanings.sent5: The frowsier smell of the attic lingered long after the boxes were removed.

meanings.definition: Frowsier: more untidy or unkempt in appearance
meanings.sent1: The frowsier hairdo made him stand out in the crowd.
meanings.sent2: The kitchen was getting frowsier with each passing day of the busy week.
meanings.sent3: Despite his frowsier appearance, he always had a warm smile for everyone.
meanings.sent4: The frowsier street was a chaotic mix of abandoned buildings and overgrown plants.
meanings.sent5: Her frowsier outfit was a result of rushing out the door in the morning.

meanings.definition: Frowsier: having a musty or stale smell
meanings.sent1: The basement grew frowsier with each rainy day.
meanings.sent2: The old books in the library had a frowsier scent that reminded her of childhood.
meanings.sent3: The frowsier odor from the attic made her wrinkle her nose in disgust.
meanings.sent4: The frowsier aroma of the antique shop transported visitors back in time.
meanings.sent5: The frowsier air in the room hinted at years of neglect and abandonment.
